result.reason: This is a Windows Server RDP session limit (Group Policy/RDS licensing), not an mRemoteNG issue - the app uses the standard Microsoft RDP ActiveX control and cannot override server-side connection limits
result.approach: No code change needed - this is a server-side configuration issue (Group Policy: Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > Windows Components > Remote Desktop Services > Remote Desktop Session Host > Connections). Users need RDS CALs and proper RDSH configuration to allow more concurrent sessions.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on my research, this is a well-known Windows Server RDP limitation, not an mRemoteNG bug. Windows Server 2012 R2+ has a default limit on concurrent RDP connections that is controlled by server-side Group Policy and licensing (Remote Desktop Session Host role + RDS CALs). mRemoteNG simply uses the standard Microsoft RDP ActiveX control (`MSTSCLib`) and has no control over server-side session limits.

Users need RDS CALs and proper RDSH configuration to allow more concurrent sessions."}
